title: To understand how AI will reconfigure humanity, try this German fairytale

content: In the German fairytale The Fisherman and His Wife, an old man one day catches a strange fish: a talking flounder. It turns out that an enchanted prince is trapped inside this fish and that it can therefore grant any wish. The man’s wife, Ilsebill, i... [7336 chars]

title: China releases new edition of AI Safety Governance Framework
description: China on Monday released version 2.0 of its Artificial Intelligence (AI) Safety Governance Framework to strengthen AI risk assessment, control, and safeguards to support

title: OpenAI hires former xAI CFO Mike Liberatore as business finance officer
description: OpenAI has hired Mike Liberatore, former finance chief at Elon Musk’s xAI, to be the artificial intelligence startup’s business finance officer.
content:
OpenAI has hired Mike Liberatore, former finance chief at Elon Musk's xAI, to be the artificial intelligence startup's business finance officer, responsible for overseeing its AI infrastructure, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Tuesday.

title: Jack Ma returns with a vengeance to ‘Make Alibaba Great Again’
description: Jack Ma, after a period away from the public eye, has returned to Alibaba, becoming actively involved in the company's strategic direction. He is influencing key decisions, particularly in artificial intelligence and the e-commerce battle against rivals like JD.com and Meituan.

title: AI Euphoria Could Be Biggest Bubble Yet, Tech Veteran Selby Says
description: The euphoria around artificial intelligence may have led to the biggest bubble yet in private technology investing, AZ-VC founder and managing partner Jack Selby said, sounding warning bells that a correction in startup valuations is in the cards.

title: Google to Invest £5 Billion to Boost AI Development in UK
description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google said it will invest £5 billion ($6.8 billion) over two years in the UK to help build an artificial intelligence economy in the country.
content:
Alphabet Inc.’s Google said it will invest £5 billion ($6.8 billion) over two years in the UK to help build an artificial intelligence economy in the country.
